ISSUE.TITLE: CI: Reevaluate use of Ubuntu
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: There's a whole swath of tests being skipped on Ubuntu: * Five because of #15025 * One because "BFQ scheduler not supported" * Sixteen because Ubuntu doesn't seem to have SELinux * Four because "checkpointing broken in Ubuntu 2004, 2104, 2110, 2204, ..." AIUI the point of using Ubuntu in CI is testing runc + cgroups v1. The point of testing runc + cgroups v1 is because that's what RHEL8 has, and not that many of us enjoy the panic-scrambles when RHEL8 gating tests fail because we haven't actually been testing very much. This is a place for us to discuss how to improve our coverage.
